data.title: Cache traits
data.body:
Cache some more trait lookups to avoid having to do it more than once where possible.

This approximately halves the time spent doing trait lookups during the game.

data.title: Update terrain layer when the terrain data changes.
data.body:
This adds plumbing to support updating a slice of a vertex buffer, and uses this to update the terrain whenever the underlying MapTiles or MapHeight arrays are modified.

This will be used by the new map editor, and is also a prerequisite for TS-style destroyable terrain (if we ever want this).

data.title: trying to reconnect on a [locked] server is now visible in the lobby
data.body:
player got kicked by administrator and probably clicked abusive on "retry" trying to reconnect ... this is now visible (with sound)

i didnt check password protected servers or just "full" server (with disabled spectators) 

feel free to rename this issue 

![lobby shit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/7334370/617fac64-eb91-11e4-972e-3bbd6afd31eb.png)

data.title: Use the correct (tile-based) radar color when updating the radar.
data.body:
The current radar code uses the global terrain type color when a cell is updated (e.g. by harvesting a resource) instead of the proper tile-defined color.

Repro case: Spam the grow resources button in TS, and then harvest them.  The minimap will turn a uniform brown / white in these areas instead of returning to the original terrain colors.

data.title: England faction has wrong flag
data.body:
The flag for the England faction in Red Alert mod is this: 
![flag](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/7333591/3a43279c-eb7e-11e4-92d7-221dc913e2d7.png)

But this flag is wrong. This is the flag of England: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Flag_of_England.svg

The flag shown in game is that of United Kingdom: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg

So either the flag has to change or the name of the faction.

data.title: Rubber band selection does not work while AttackMove is active
data.body:
Hello,

Since 24042015 release there is an annoying bug which is causing selection of units difficult when using hotkeys. Say you are selecting some units and move them using attack command then try to select another group by dragging on screen.. it doesn't work as it should.

In other words.. when your cursor is green you can select and re-select any group of units by dragging on screen... if you cursor is red you can't .

data.title: Battlefield News stops blinking if you switch mods
data.body:
The Battlefields News button stops blinking if you switch mods.

This is a little bit annoying because a player might miss the message if he/she switches mods.

After switching mods, a news.yaml file is added in the content folder while the player hasn't even clicked on the Battlefield News button/drop-down menu.

data.title: Added quick build feature
data.body:
Closes #7964.

Pressing the production tab hotkey selects the completed building so it can be placed.

data.title: System.InvalidOperationException: Unit `bomblet` does not have a sequence named `open`
data.body: Happens when you use a parabomb support power (from crates) in Fort Lonestar.

data.title: Server cannot detect latency and drops players
data.body:
It seems the server sometimes cannot detect latency and drops players off. It is also possible to join multiple times.

![bildschirmfoto 2015-04-25 um 15 18 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/339613/7333041/af040f76-eb5e-11e4-8644-918c137c9361.png)

data.title: helicopter gets overlapped by buildings
data.body:
probably regression from #7842

![regression chopper](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/7332662/d9a0b04a-eb4a-11e4-9083-123a4852dc42.png)

data.title: Remove magic ActorReference/SmudgeReference parsing
data.body:
This removes the ActorReference and SmudgeReference creation from Map, and instead exposes the raw yaml tree.  Upgrade rules are now able to modify these definitions (needed for #4251 and #7475) and it makes the ownership/responsibilities clearer for the ingame map editor. 

Depends on #7875.

The legacy map importer works (except for the player bug inherited from #7875), but I have not been able to test the d2k importer or the legacy editor.

data.title: Fix a problem with hijackers in the survival maps
data.body:
As reported by @Snurre86 in IRC, tanks kept moving to their waypoints/starting
a hunt activity even after you captured them with a hijacker.

data.title: Add sandworm attack sound
data.body:
Removes a few unused lines of YAML and adds the worm sound.
May be worth delaying the player notifications by a second; it would probably sound better.

This is also the simplest thing on my Next+1 feature wishlist.

data.title: Extracted actor Voices from Selectable into own Voiced trait
data.body: And implemented `IVoiced` interface to move `Voiced` to Common.

data.title: Move prone-related logic from DamageWarhead to TakeCover
data.body:
This is some random logic cleanup. The "prone" state in infantry-specific logic, which is handled by the `TakeCover` trait. Warheads should know nothing of it. Especially while they are in the engine.
The `DamageTypes` property of `DamageWarhead` can be used for interaction with other traits in the future. First thing that comes to mind are shields.

This is hopefully the first step to cleaning up the warhead code a bit.
Sorry for the big PR, but it's 90% YAML, so it's not as scary as it looks ;)

data.title: Gun and Rocket turrets are named incorrectly
data.body: From the website comments: "Guys dont forget to change the names back to the originals such as rocket tower in d2k which should be turret (same for gun turret)"

data.title: Proper Effects for TS Energy Weapons (LaserZap)
data.body:
Replacing LaserZap Effect by something nice inspired by original TS. Used for TS / TD

Idea: Transparent with a wave effect.

data.title: Path finder should ignore blocking units when pathing over bridges
data.body:
Changes to Path Finding Algorithm:

1) Handling of temporally occupied tiles. For example a bridge with a tank on it. It is still possible to go over that bridge. In most cases the tank will be gone when reaching the bridge.

2) TS: Handling of automatic gates. A gate is a occupied tile until it opens. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/11866289-path-finder-should-ignore-blocking-units-when-pathing-over-bridges?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Clean up state properly when a Carryall's cargo has died
data.body:
Fixes #8006.

To elaborate a bit, the [`PickupUnit` activity checks the health of the cargo and calls `Carryall::UnreserveCarryable` if it's dead](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.D2k/Activities/PickupUnit.cs#L49), so that would be the right place to unset `anim`.

data.title: Remove deprecated Buildable.Owner field.
GDI Dropship Bay
data.body:
Deep in the code for Tiberian Sun, there was something about a Reinforcement Bay. I remember one of the guys from Petroglyph Studios in a forum thread saying that it was a GDI structure and was supposed to act like the CHOAM Starport in the Dune series of games (except that a GDI dropship, instead of Carryall would be used to deliver the units).

This would be a very cool addition to the open-source version of Tiberian Sun that would help complete what the original creators wanted to do with the game.

data.title: GDI Dropship Bay
data.body:
Deep in the code for Tiberian Sun, there was something about a Reinforcement Bay. I remember one of the guys from Petroglyph Studios in a forum thread saying that it was a GDI structure and was supposed to act like the CHOAM Starport in the Dune series of games (except that a GDI dropship, instead of Carryall) would be used to deliver the units.

This would be a very cool addition to the open-source version of Tiberian Sun that would help complete what the original creators wanted to do with the game.

data.title: Hardware cursor fixes
data.body:
This fixes a problem on Windows where hardware cursors fail sporadically. We were also leaking hardware cursors on mod switches, so that's fixed too.

---

On bleed, I can occasionally reproduce the following error on Windows during mod switches. I imagine it can also appear at game startup if you're unlucky.

```
Failed to initialize hardware cursors. Falling back to software cursors.
Error was: Failed to create hardware cursor `random-cursor-name`: CreateIconIndirect(): The parameter is incorrect.
```

I imagine either SDL or Windows is doing something silly that causes [CreateIconIndirect](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms648062%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) to fail occasionally. You can retry the call with the same parameters and it will work the second time (indeed, it works >99% of the time).

data.title: Fix yaml merging
data.body:
Fixes #2922
Fixes #6818 
Fixes #7999

The existing merge/inherits code was hairy, and mostly bogus.
We will need to be careful about regressions from other code that may be assuming the bogus behaviour.

data.title: MiniYaml unit tests are completely bogus
data.body: 4 / 5 of the tests are about testing "Inherits:", but that has nothing to do with MiniYaml merging (it is part of ActorInfo).  I will include some proper tests as part of my fix for #2922 and #6818.
